title: How to Make a Temporary Tattoo with Paper

steps.title: Purchase water slide paper.
steps.content: Purchase water slide paper. Most tattoo stickers are made with water slide paper, which makes the tattoo stick onto the skin and last. You can purchase water slide paper from a craft store or online. [1] X Research source If you don't have access to water slide paper, normal printing paper will work as well.

steps.title: Choose a picture online or create your own.
steps.content: Choose a picture online or create your own. You can find a cool tattoo by looking up "tattoo designs" online or create your own using Photoshop. Choose a tattoo that is meaningful to you. You can print out special symbols, a character, or a drawing of an animal.

steps.title: Print out your picture.
steps.content: Print out your picture. Remember to flip the tattoo before you print it, especially if it contains words, as the tattoo will appear mirrored once you apply it. You can print in color; however, black works best. Print the picture as big as you want it. If you're creating batches of tattoos, a smaller size is best.

steps.title: Cut out your picture.
steps.content: Cut out your picture. Leave a 1/2 inch rim around the edges. The picture shouldn't be cut too small. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Soak your picture in perfume.
steps.content: Soak your picture in perfume. Spray the front and back of the paper with a scented perfume of your choice. Apply a generous amount.

steps.title: Soak the picture in hot water for three minutes.
steps.content: Soak the picture in hot water for three minutes. Fill up a sink or small bowl with hot water and place your picture gently on top. Gently push the picture to break the water's surface and let it sink. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Allow the paper to soak for three minutes.
steps.content: Allow the paper to soak for three minutes. It's helpful to set a timer to remind you to remove the paper. Once the paper has finished soaking, remove it from the water and spray it with perfume again.

steps.title: Apply the tattoo to your skin.
steps.content: Apply the tattoo to your skin. Pick an area where you'd like the tattoo to go, such as your wrist or arm. Spray the side of the paper that you're sticking onto your skin with perfume. Place the ink side of the paper face down on your skin and spray it with perfume once applied.

steps.title: Allow the tattoo to adhere to the skin for seven minutes.
steps.content: Allow the tattoo to adhere to the skin for seven minutes. Once the timer is up, carefully remove the tattoo. Starting from the edges, slowly peel the paper away from your skin. [4] X Research source If you have paper residue on the tattoo, wash it off with water, don't try to rub it off, it will ruin the tattoo.

steps.title: Gently pat the tattoo dry with a towel.
steps.content: Gently pat the tattoo dry with a towel. Now you have a brand new waterproof temporary tattoo that should last for up to a month! If you for some reason want or need to remove the tattoo, rubbing alcohol on the skin will wash it off.
